      • minimax

        public static int minimax(int depth,
                          java.lang.String playerMark,
                          java.lang.String computerMark,
                          java.lang.String humanMark)
        This method implements the game theory for minimizing loss for maximum loss scenario
        Parameters:
        depth - This parameter contains the number of levels in minimax tree
        playerMark - Represents the current player mark
        computerMark - Represents the computer player mark
        humanMark - Represents the human player mark
        Returns:
        Represents the score at that depth level of the tree

      • max

        public static int max(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> score)
        This method picks maximum value
        Parameters:
        score - This represents the array of scores returned from minimax algorithm
        Returns:
        It returns maximum value from the array of scores

      • min

        public static int min(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> score)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Returns minimum value from the array of scores

      • bestMove

        public static int bestMove()
        This methods goes though all maximum values from minimax scores and picks the board cells that can are applicable for these values, selects one cell and returns selected cell number.
        Returns:
        Returns selected cell position
